ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.data

Class FragmentPart

  • java.lang.Object
    • ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.data.FragmentPart
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class FragmentPart
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A FragmentPart can represent different forms of content for a Fragment. The forms that FragmentPart can currently represent include; text segments, illustrations, and choices. There is also a special type called empty. empty is used for ensuring there is at least one entry in a Fragment's FragmentPart list. Without at least one entry the used would be unable to create anymore FragmentParts for the Fragment. The design pattern Null Object was used in this class. As can be seen when an object of this class is instantiated all fields are initialized to non-null values.
    See Also:
    Choice, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • FragmentPart

        public FragmentPart(java.lang.String type)
        Creates an empty FragmentPart of type. The FragmentPart's type is a flag that tells what kind of data will be stored in the FragmentPart. The type can be: "t" for text "c" for choice "i" for illustration "e" for an empty part.
        Parameters:
        type - they type of FragmentPart to create

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        The FragmentPart's type is a flag that tells what kind of data will be stored in the FragmentPart. The type can be: "t" for text "c" for choice "i" for illustration "e" for an empty part.
        Returns:
        type the type of the FragmentPart
        See Also:
        Choice

      • getData

        public java.lang.String getData()
        The data The data field is used to store data for the "t" (text) and "i" (illustration) types. For text it stores the text that should be displayed. For illustrations it stores the location of the picture that it references.
        Returns:
        data the data stored in a FragmentPart

      • setData

        public void setData(java.lang.String data)
        The data to set The data field should only be used for "t" (text) and "i" (illustration) types. For text it stores the text that should be displayed. For illustrations it stores the location of the picture that it references.
        Parameters:
        data - the string to set a FragmentPart's data field to

      • getChoice

        public Choice getChoice()
        The choice field is used by type "c" (choice) FragmentParts to store a Choice object. The Choice object is used when users are reading a story, selecting it will take the user to the next Fragment, as indicated by the Choice.
        Returns:
        choice the Choice stored in a FragmentPart's choice field
        See Also:
        Fragment, Choice

      • setChoice

        public void setChoice(Choice choice)
        The choice field is used by type "c" (choice) FragmentParts to store a Choice object. The Choice object is used when users are reading a story, selecting it will take the user to the next Fragment, as indicated by the Choice.
        Parameters:
        choice - the Choice to be stored in the FragmenPart's choice field.
        See Also:
        Fragment, Choice

      • getPicSize

        public int getPicSize()
        The choice field is used by type "i" (illustration) FragmentParts to store an illustration size flag. The flag is used to determine whether the picture should be displayed in a larger or smaller container.
        Returns:
        picSize the flag stored the FragmentPart's picSize field

      • setPicSize

        public void setPicSize(int picSize)
        The choice field is used by type "i" (illustration) FragmentParts to store an illustration size flag. The flag is used to determine whether the picture should be displayed in a larger or smaller container.
